shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables video streams with different quality levels on the sender side.
Enables or disables dual-stream mode on the sending side.

p.codeblock: virtual int enableDualStreamModeEx(bool enabled, const SimulcastStreamConfig& streamConfig, const RtcConnection& connection) = 0;
public abstract int enableDualStreamModeEx(boolean enabled, SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig, RtcConnection connection);

section.p: Video streams with different quality levels consist of a pair of high-quality (high bitrate, high resolution) and low-quality (low bitrate, low resolution) streams. After enabling this feature, you can call the method on the subscriber side to choose to receive either high- or low-quality video streams.

You can call this method to enable or disable dual-stream mode on the sending side. Dual-stream consists of a high-quality video stream and a low-quality video stream:
High-quality stream: High bitrate, high resolution.
Low-quality stream: Low bitrate, low resolution. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call setRemoteVideoStreamType to choose whether to receive the high-quality or low-quality stream on the receiving side.
section.note: This method applies to all types of video streams on the sender side, including but not limited to camera-captured streams, screen sharing streams, and custom captured streams.
This method applies to all types of video streams on the sending side, including but not limited to camera-captured video, screen sharing, and custom captured video streams.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method is applicable in multi-channel scenarios.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable video streams with different quality levels:
: Enable.
: (Default) Disable.
Configuration for the low-quality stream. See . When mode is set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM, setting streamConfig has no effect.

Whether to enable dual-stream mode:
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.
Configuration of the low-quality stream. See . When mode is set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM, streamConfig has no effect.
